title: IndiGo cancellations: DGCA says over 1,200 flights affected; probe under way
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has launched a probe into IndiGo's network disruptions, citing massive flight delays and cancellations. The airline reported 1,232 flight cancellations in November due to crew constraints and ATC failures. IndiGo attributed the issues to unexpected operational problems, including technical glitches and winter schedule adjustments.

title: Inside Karnataka's GoT: Sidda-DKS faceoff was a long time coming - explained
content: Karnataka's chief ministerial post remains undecided despite meetings between Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar. The Congress high command faces a complex challenge involving loyalty, caste arithmetic, and the party's future in the state. Both leaders are awaiting a decision from Delhi, with potential solutions ranging from status quo to power rotation.

title: 1 post a minute: Trump's manic 'Truths' raise eyebrows; what did he say
content: President Trump unleashed over 160 posts on Truth Social in a late-night digital barrage, questioning his governing priorities and mental acuity. The frenetic output, exceeding one post per minute, included political attacks, conspiracy claims, and boasts, followed by a cabinet meeting where he appeared to nod off.

title: Taj Mahal 'curse' for Agra? BJP MP blames TTZ for hindering growth; proposes IT hub
content: BJP MP Rajkumar Chahar stated that the Taj Mahal's protective regulations have become a "curse" for Agra, hindering industrial development and job creation. He argued that strict Taj Trapezium Zone and NGT norms prevent industries from being set up, leading to youth unemployment. Chahar advocated for an IT hub to balance development with preserving the monument's beauty.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on AI fear that makes him lose sleep
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai voiced concerns about AI's dual nature, highlighting deepfakes as his biggest worry. While acknowledging AI's potential for groundbreaking medical advancements, he stressed the risks posed by malicious actors. Pichai also revealed his personal method of gauging product success by actively monitoring social media feedback on platforms like X.

title: Advanced BrahMos, hypersonic systems: India eyes defence boost; what's Putin offering?
content: India and Russia are set to discuss advanced BrahMos missile development during President Putin's visit.  Following its success in Operation Sindoor, India seeks lighter, versatile BrahMos-NG variants for its Air Force and extended-range systems.  This collaboration underscores the strong Indo-Russian strategic partnership, with further talks on next-gen hypersonic and air-to-air missiles also anticipated.

title: Putin's visit under Trump tariff shadow: What's at stake for India and Russia? Explained
content: Russian President Putin's India visit is crucial for trade dynamics amidst US pressure. India's energy security is now heavily reliant on discounted Russian crude, reshaping its procurement patterns. The visit aims to manage dependence in a fractured world, focusing on securing fuel, weapons, and payments.

title: Tech layoffs: IBM CEO says job cuts not due to AI; blames overhiring in Covid years
content: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna attributes current tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring, not AI, calling it a "natural correction." While acknowledging AI will cause some job displacement, Krishna believes increased productivity will lead to new roles and overall hiring growth, particularly for college graduates.

title: AI psychosis: Inside eerie trend of AI dependence â€” and why it's dangerous
content: AI assistants are evolving from tools to emotional anchors, with people forming deep, private bonds with chatbots as therapists and friends. This reliance, driven by immediacy and comfort, blurs lines between reality and imagination, leading to potential emotional dependency and even 'AI psychosis.' While AI offers a low-effort outlet for unfiltered conversations, experts warn it cannot replace genuine human connection and empathy, highlighting the profound impact on our emotional landscapes.

title: Kohliâ€™s Vijay Hazare comeback: Will fans be allowed in Bengaluru? KSCAopens up
content: Virat Kohli is set to return to domestic white-ball cricket after 15 years in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, playing for Delhi in Bengaluru. His participation, confirmed by DDCA president Rohan Jaitley, adds significant star power alongside Rishabh Pant. While fixtures are set, spectator access at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium remains uncertain, pending government approval.

title: '48hrs to fix flight chaos': IndiGo offers update; what's causing disruptions
content: IndiGo has apologised for widespread flight disruptions over the past two days. The airline cited a combination of technical glitches, winter schedule changes, bad weather, airport congestion, and new crew rostering rules. To address the situation, IndiGo has adjusted its flight schedules for the next 48 hours. Affected passengers are being offered alternative flights or refunds.

title: How to know if your gmail account is hacked, simple ways to check and prevent it
content: Your Gmail account holds vital personal and financial data. Unauthorised access can compromise sensitive information. Google offers tools to review recent logins and active devices. Checking this activity helps identify suspicious access. Users can then secure their accounts by changing passwords and signing out unknown devices. Proactive security measures protect your digital identity.

title: Elden Campbell net worth: Late Lakers starâ€™s fortune after his passing at 57
content: Former Los Angeles Lakers player Elden Campbell has passed away at the age of 57. Campbell was a key member of the Detroit Pistons team that won the NBA championship in 2004. He played 15 seasons in the NBA, earning over $69 million. His career included stints with the Lakers, Hornets, Pistons, and Nets.

title: 'I have come here to...': DKS lands in Delhi; K'taka CM intrigue grows
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar arrived in Delhi, stating his visit is for a wedding and to arrange a rally, not for political discussions with the high command. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah indicated he would only travel to Delhi if called by party leaders, as internal party dynamics continue to surface.

title: Where's your ITR refund? Experts explain reasons for delay; what taxpayers should do
content: Income tax refunds are significantly delayed this assessment year, with processing times extended even for routine cases. Official data shows a substantial drop in refund outgo compared to last year, attributed to late form releases, increased verification, and processing constraints. Experts anticipate a continued trend of slower processing, particularly for high-value refunds.

title: Cardi B shares sweet glimpse of newborn son, calls him her â€˜cuddle buddyâ€™
content: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Lakers legend Elden Campbell dies at 57; what we know about his cause of death
content: Elden Campbell, a dependable big man for the Lakers in the '90s, has died at 57. The Los Angeles native played 8Â½ seasons with his hometown team, bridging eras before winning a championship with the Detroit Pistons in 2004. Known for his calm, fluid style, Campbell was a valued role player who earned respect throughout his 15-year NBA career.

title: Travis Kelce reveals unexpected detail about calm 2.5-year Taylor Swift bond
content: Travis Kelce revealed on his podcast, New Heights, that he and Taylor Swift have never argued in their two and a half years together. He shared this during a conversation with George Clooney, who also spoke about his argument-free marriage. Kelce stated he's 'taking notes' from Clooney's approach to maintaining a peaceful relationship.

title: Liver-friendly diet: 10 foods that boost liver health, reduce fat and improve function
content: Nourishing your liver is crucial for overall health, and diet plays a significant role. This article explores ten scientifically backed foods, including coffee, green tea, and fatty fish, that can help reduce inflammation, protect against fat accumulation, and improve liver enzymes. Incorporating these nutrient-dense options supports the liver's vital functions.

title: Tension at Bhopal tragedy rally: BJP alleges plan to burn RSS effigy; police intervene
content: A Bhopal gas tragedy commemoration rally turned contentious as BJP supporters alleged protesters intended to burn an RSS effigy alongside one representing Dow Chemical. Police intervened, removing the effigy after a complaint, citing it was offensive and warning against targeting any organisation. Survivor groups denied the accusation, stating effigies represented those responsible for the disaster.

title: Rupee plummets: Currency hits all-time low of 90.21 vs $; what's driving crash
content: The Indian Rupee hit a historic low on Wednesday, crossing the 90-per-dollar mark for the first time. This decline was driven by foreign fund outflows, rising crude oil prices, and uncertainty surrounding the India-US trade deal. Market watchers noted a lack of Reserve Bank of India intervention for much of the session.

title: Naagin fame Aashka Goradia announces second pregnancy with husband Brent Goble
content: Actress Aashka Goradia and husband Brent Goble are expecting their second child, due in May 2026. They announced the happy news on their eighth wedding anniversary with a beach-themed video. The couple, who reside in Goa, are already parents to Alexander and are looking forward to their growing family.

title: 'Pre-installation not mandatory': Govt rolls back Sanchar Saathi order
content: The government has withdrawn its mandate for mobile manufacturers to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi app on new smartphones. This decision follows concerns about privacy and surveillance, with the government clarifying the app's purpose is solely for citizen cybersecurity. The app's growing user acceptance has led to the voluntary installation option.

title: Clippers cut Chris Paul: Teamâ€™s sudden statement reveals shocking decision
content: The Los Angeles Clippers announced they are parting ways with veteran guard Chris Paul, just weeks into the 2025-2026 season. This decision came after Paul posted a cryptic Instagram story about being sent home. The team's statement clarified the departure, emphasizing that Paul is not to blame for their struggles and expressing gratitude for his contributions.

title: 'Humanitarian grounds': SC allows deported pregnant woman to return from Bangladesh
content: The Supreme Court allowed a pregnant woman and her child to enter India on humanitarian grounds after their deportation to Bangladesh. The court directed the West Bengal government to provide care and medical support, including delivery, for the woman. This decision follows the Centre's challenge to a Calcutta High Court order that deemed the deportation illegal.

title: Crew crunch hits IndiGo: Over 200 flights cancelled; chaos at major airports
content: IndiGo is experiencing significant flight delays and cancellations, impacting nearly two out of three domestic passengers. This disruption stems from a critical crew shortage following the implementation of new flight duty time limitations. The airline, known for its punctuality, has seen its on-time performance plummet, causing widespread inconvenience during the peak travel season.

title: Delhiâ€™s pollution surge puts heart and diabetes patients at risk
content: In a dire report from Delhi, healthcare facilities have logged more than 200,000 cases of acute respiratory issues, predominantly threatening at-risk groups such as those with diabetes and heart ailments. The toxic smog is not just a nuisance; it intensifies pre-existing health conditions, causing rapid arterial narrowing and extra stress on the heart.

title: Drake London injury: Falcons coach breaks silence on recovery timeline
content: Atlanta Falcons head coach Raheem Morris provided an update on wide receiver Drake London's knee injury, stating he is "day-to-day" and "getting better" with a "chance" to play against the Seattle Seahawks. London has missed the last two games due to a PCL strain, with the team struggling in his absence.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill gets vice-captain role for T20Is â€” with one major BCCI condition
content: Shubman Gill has been named Suryakumar Yadav's deputy for the upcoming T20I series against South Africa, pending medical clearance. Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah also return to the 15-member squad. Rinku Singh has been omitted from the team that recently toured Australia. The series commences on December 9.

title: IND vs SA: BCCI announces India's 15-man squad for South Africa T20Is; Gill included with a twist
content: Suryakumar Yadav will captain India's T20I squad against South Africa, with Shubman Gill named vice-captain pending fitness. The team features a strong batting lineup including Abhishek Sharma and Hardik Pandya, alongside versatile all-rounders and a balanced bowling attack led by Jasprit Bumrah and spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakaravarthy.

title: New look, new colours: Team India's T20 World Cup 2026 jersey revealed
content: The jersey was unveiled by former India captain Rohit Sharma who is also the brand ambassador of the tournament, and member of the Indian T20 side Tilak Varma. The upcoming T20 World Cup will be co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka and is set to begin on February 7, with the final scheduled for March 8. Suryakumar Yadav and his team will kick off their campaign against the USA on February 7 in Mumbai.

title: Ex-Leafs GM hints Toronto picked the wrong captain in Auston Matthews
content: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.

title: No to Russian gas: EU aims to ban supply by 2027 - what's the plan?
content: The European Union has agreed to completely halt Russian gas imports by autumn 2027, ending new long-term pipeline contracts by September 30, 2027, and LNG deals by January 1, 2027. This move aims to enhance energy security and independence, with a roadmap also being drafted to eliminate Russian oil imports to Hungary and Slovakia by the same deadline.

title: Delhi MCD bypolls: BJP sweeps major seats, AAP secures narrow wins; check full list of winners
content: The BJP secured a dominant victory in the Delhi Municipal Corporation bypolls, winning seven out of twelve wards. The AAP managed to win three seats, while the Congress and AIFB secured one each. This outcome is seen as a significant electoral test for the BJP following their recent rise to power in Delhi.

title: 'Clocking speed of 140 kmph': Influencer dies in horrific crash; named his bike 'Laila'
content: An 18-year-old died after losing control of his KTM sports bike near Surat's Breadliner Circle. Speeding and reportedly not wearing a helmet, Prince Patel crashed into the road divider, sustaining fatal head injuries. He was known for posting high-speed bike videos on social media.

title: Second complaint filed against Ranveer Singh despite apology for hurting religious sentiments
content: A Bengaluru advocate has filed a new complaint against actor Ranveer Singh. The complaint alleges Singh disrespected Tulu spirit-worship during the IFFI closing ceremony. This follows an earlier complaint and Singh's public apology. The advocate claims Singh's actions were derogatory and caused hurt to the Tulu community. Legal proceedings are sought against the actor.

title: Anushka's adorable reaction to Virat Kohli's 53rd ODI century goes viral â€” See post
content: Virat Kohli smashed his 53rd ODI century, a remarkable 102, in India's second match against South Africa. This century, his second consecutive of the series, propelled his international tally to 84 hundreds. He also set a new record for consecutive ODI centuries, surpassing AB de Villiers.

title: RPSC ASO 2025 answer key released; objection window now open
content: The Rajasthan Public Service Commission has released the provisional answer key for the Assistant Statistical Officer exam. Candidates can now check their tentative scores and raise objections against any discrepancies. The window for submitting challenges, along with supporting documents and a fee, opens on December 4, 2025, and closes on December 6, 2025.

title: Carter Hart returns after case, leads Golden Knights to 4-3 win vs Blackhawks
content: Carter Hart returned to NHL action after nearly two years, making 30 saves and delivering crucial stops in a 4-3 shootout win for the Vegas Golden Knights. Despite early rust and allowing three goals, Hart found his form late, securing his first NHL victory since January 2024 and signaling a hopeful step forward in his comeback.

title: Nasaâ€™s Bennu asteroid holds secrets of life hidden for billions of years
content: Bennu asteroid samples returned by NASA's OSIRIS-REx mission reveal life's building blocks, including sugars like ribose and glucose. Scientists also found a unique nitrogen-rich polymer, offering clues to early life's chemical origins. The asteroid's high concentration of supernova dust sheds light on its formation environment and the distribution of presolar materials in our early solar system.

title: â€˜Kitne paise chahiye tereko?â€™: Sunny Deol loses his cool at sneaky pap- video
content: Sunny Deol blasts sneaky paparazzoâ€”"Paisa chahiye? Kitne paise chahiye tere ko?"â€”during Dharmendra's Haridwar asthi visarjan video. The icon died Nov 24 post-hospital stay; family immersed ashes Dec 3 privately. Sunny, Bobby led rites; he has 6 kids from wives Prakash Kaur, Hema Malini.

title: 'Give Royal Enfield or Rs 2 lakh': UP bride thrown out day after marriage over dowry
content: A Kanpur bride was shockingly sent back to her parental home just a day after her wedding due to dowry demands. Her in-laws allegedly demanded a Royal Enfield motorcycle or Rs 2 lakh, forcibly took her gifts, and physically assaulted her. Police have registered a case against the groom and his family.

title: Silver futures cross Rs 1.85 lakh per kg mark as rupee dips
content: Silver price today: Silver prices surged to a new high of Rs 1,84,727 per kilogram on Wednesday, driven by a weakening rupee and strong international market trends. Gold futures also climbed significantly, with both precious metals benefiting from expectations of a US Federal Reserve interest rate cut next week.

title: IND vs SA: Why Harshit Rana was reprimanded by ICC; India pacer accepts the charge
content: Indian pacer Harshit Rana has been reprimanded by the ICC for a provocative send-off of Dewald Brevis during India's ODI win over South Africa. Rana received one demerit point for violating the Code of Conduct, accepting the sanction without a hearing. India aims to seal the series in Raipur.

title: NFL Week 14 buzz: What we're hearing on Bryce Young, Shedeur Sanders and tight division races
content: Will Carolina extend Bryce Young? Could Cleveland stick with Shedeur Sanders in 2026? Here's the latest intel.

title: Browns open 21-day practice window for Watson
content: Browns QB Deshaun Watson is available to practice after being designated to return from the PUP list following last year's season-ending Achilles injury.

title: Amid Tomlin angst, Big Ben floats Penn State job
content: Two Steelers legends have joined the chorus of voices calling for the franchise to move on from Mike Tomlin, with Ben Roethlisberger even suggesting that Tomlin is a good fit for the vacant Penn State job.

title: Free-falling Clippers abruptly sever ties with Paul
content: Chris Paul, one of the greatest players in Clippers franchise history, posted an Instagram story a little before 3 a.m. ET Wednesday that he had just learned he was being sent home to Los Angeles from Atlanta.

title: Campbell, Clemson great, NBA champ, dies at 57
content: Elden Campbell, the all-time leading scorer at Clemson who played for the Lakers in the 1990s and won an NBA title with the Pistons, has died at the age of 57.

title: Sources: No. 1 recruit to hold off on LSU signing
content: LSU pledge Lamar Brown, ESPN's No. 1 overall prospect in the 2026 class, is waiting for Lane Kiffin to assemble his staff before signing with the Tigers.

title: Fitzgerald: 'There will be no more motivated coach'
content: Pat Fitzgerald spoke with eight schools about potential coaching jobs, looking for the best place to resume his career, before choosing Michigan State. "It was almost a no-brainer for me when the opportunity was presented," he said Tuesday.

title: Kraft, Belichick to both appear on HOF ballot
content: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft will face off against three senior nominees next month for induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: Lions WR St. Brown likely a game-time decision
content: Lions receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown (sprained ankle) has yet to practice this week and is likely to be a game-time decision against the Cowboys on Thursday night.

title: ðŸ‘‹ Final farewell to Kiffin and rest of Bottom 10
content: With the season over and the final votes tallied, we crown the best of the worst -- on and off the field.

content: What's next for Chris Paul? What about the Clippers, who are struggling badly? We answered five questions about this big roster shakeup.

content: The 2026 recruiting cycle is almost finished. Here's how this class will impact college football next season.

content: Here's what some of the best teams will be targeting this offseason -- and which players fit those needs.

title: UNC volleyball's Jackie Taylor honors late father, NFL legend Sean Taylor
content: Jackie Taylor wears No. 21 for North Carolina. When she leaps for a ball and slams it to the ground, NFL fans remember a man she never met.

title: How CFB's 'calendar' problem affects athletes more than coaches such as Lane Kiffin
content: Unlike coaches, high school kids don't have multimillion-dollar buyouts to fall back on, Dan Wetzel writes.

content: Who are the NFL's best rookies through Week 13? How do Carson Schwesinger and Jaxson Dart stack up? Here's our top-10 list, plus big questions on the class.

content: NBA insiders break down the first Power Rankings of December, evaluating all 30 teams as the end of the year draws near.

content: The FIFA World Cup draw is happening Friday, and 42 of the 48 teams are confirmed. But what's one thing you need to know about each nation?

content: After a tumultuous campaign, the veteran superstar is now looking ahead to big things with the Stars.

content: What was Danilo Gallinari, who earned more than $200M in the NBA, doing in Puerto Rico? Ending a decades-long chase.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: Many star volleyball players are wearing a hair-tie solution invented by three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: Vancouver isn't built around its star, and MÃ¼ller & Co. are better for it
content: Instead of building the plane around Thomas MÃ¼ller, the Vancouver Whitecaps asked the Germany legend to fit around their structure -- and it has worked.

content: EstÃªvÃ£o's brilliant goal against Barcelona showed beyond doubt his extraordinary talent, but Chelsea have been carefully managing his development.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs ready to move for Liverpool's Salah
content: Mohamed Salah has long been a target for clubs in the Saudi Pro League. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: Can Joe Burrow lead you to a Week 14 win? These seven players Can make or break your fantasy playoff run.

title: 'I do record everything': The told and untold stories of Merab Dvalishvili
content: Dvalishvili, the UFC champion Dana White once called "next-level stupid," is slowly taking over the internet.

title: From bed rest to champion: Chet Holmgren is just getting started
content: Holmgren was sidelined for three months last season because of a fractured pelvis and is "chasing for more" this season.

title: How to bet the Heisman Trophy race, which comes down to the Big Ten championship game
content: With the race expected to come down to Indiana QB Fernando Mendoza and Ohio State QB Julian Sayin, the Big Ten championship game likely determines who wins the Heisman Trophy.

title: Elderly Couple Homeless After House Seized By CPM-Backed Cooperative Bank In Kerala
content: The eviction of an elderly couple from their house in Kerala over loan dues has led to a huge public outcry, especially after the state's Left government recently brought a law to protect families from losing their only home due to mortgage issues.

title: Official Slaps Student, Manhandles Farmers Agitated Over Fertiliser Shortage In Madhya Pradesh
content: A major controversy erupted during fertilizer distribution in Chhatarpur district of Madhya Pradesh when the subsidised fertiliser being distributed by the government ran short.

title: Sanctions-Hit Iran's Rial Crashes To Record Low Of 1.2 Million To Dollar
content: Iran's rial currency fell Wednesday to a new low of 1.2 million to the US dollar as nuclear sanctions squeeze Tehran's ailing economy.

title: 'Broken Backbone, Soaked In Blood': Man, 25, Making Reels Plunges To Death
content: A 25-year-old man died after falling from a 50-foot bridge in the Raisen district of Madhya Pradesh while allegedly filming a reel with his mobile phone, a police official said on Wednesday.

title: 'Restrict Arguments To 15 Minutes': Top Court To Lawyers In Delhi Riots Case
content: Observing that a time schedule is required to be fixed for arguments, the Supreme Court on Wednesday directed the lawyers appearing for the accused in the February 2020 Delhi riots to restrict their oral arguments to 15 minutes.

title: Video: Chairs, Kicks, Punches Fly After 'Rasgulla Shortage' At Bihar Wedding
content: A wedding in Bihar's Bodh Gaya descended into a chaotic battlezone between the bride and the groom's families over shortage of rasgulla.

title: Explained: What Led To Over 200 IndiGo Flights Being Cancelled Across India
content: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is grappling with one of its most serious operational disruptions in recent years, as more than 200 flights were cancelled and hundreds more delayed across major airports on Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Uncle Rapes 14-Year-Old Orphan In Uttar Pradesh, Arrested
content: A 14-year-old orphan girl was allegedly raped by her uncle at his house in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday, police said.

title: Mumbai To Get New Tunnel, 13.9-km Elevated Freeway To Slash Travel Time
content: With an eye on the upcoming municipal corporation elections, especially the big-ticket Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) poll, the Mahayuti Government is ensuring high-value and high-visibility projects get off the ground.

title: EU Lawmakers Reach Deal To Ban Russian Gas Imports By Autumn 2027
content: European Union lawmakers and member states reached a deal Wednesday to ban all imports of Russian gas by autumn 2027, as the bloc seeks to choke off key funds feeding Moscow's war chest.

title: NATO Allies Pledge To Buy US Arms Worth Millions For Ukraine
content: NATO countries pledged Wednesday to buy hundreds of millions more dollars of US arms for Ukraine, as Russian President Vladimir Putin was told to end his "bluster" and get serious on peace talks.

title: German President Arrives In UK, First Visit By Head Of State In 27 Years
content: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier arrived in London on Wednesday for the start of a state visit, the first by the official German head of state in 27 years.

title: Woman Arrested In 'Land Scam' Linked To Company Owned By Ajit Pawars Son
content: Pune Police on Wednesday arrested Shital Tejwani, an accused in the case linked to the controversial sale of government land in Mundhwa area to a company owned by Maharashtra deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's son Parth Pawar.

title: Over 100 Students Charged After Clashes At Banaras Hindu University
content: Over 100 students have been booked after the Banaras Hindu University campus witnessed heavy stone pelting and damage to vehicles as a clash broke out between the students and the university's security personnel late on Tuesday night

title: 200 IndiGo Flights Cancelled, Ops Hit, Airline Blames "Flight Duty" Audit
content: IndiGo, India's largest airline, is facing one of its most severe operational breakdowns in recent years, with flight delays and cancellations sweeping across the country.

title: "Cocking A Snook": Court Raps Tamil Nadu For "Disobeying" Temple Lamp Order
content: In a late-evening development today, the Madurai bench of the Madras High Court pulled up the Tamil Nadu government for wilful disobedience after the Karthigai Deepam (holy lamp) was not lit on the ancient Deepathoon pillar at Thirupparankundram.

title: OTP To Be Mandatory For Tatkal Tickets Bought At Reservation Counters
content: To book Tatkal train tickets from railway reservation counters, passengers will now have to provide a one-time password received on their mobile phones, a move officials say is aimed at curbing misuse of the last-minute ticket booking facility.

title: 'Want To Remove Thorn': Maharashtra Caste Murder Accused Told Mother
content: The mother of 20-year-old Saksham Tate, who was allegedly murdered last week by his girlfriend's family members in Maharashtra's Nanded, on Wednesday alleged that the accused had told her that he was a "thorn" they wanted to remove from their lives.

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 3 Highlights: Rajya Sabha Resumes Proceedings
content: On the third day of the Parliament's Winter Session, the government is set to resume key legislative business in the Lok Sabha, with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman likely to move the Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025.

title: Panipat's "Killer Mom" Murders Young Son, Niece, 2 Others
content: A woman has been arrested for murdering her 6-year-old niece in Haryana's Panipat, police said on Wednesday. The reason: she did not want anyone to look "more beautiful" than her.

title: Abu Dhabi GP: The ultimate preview for the 2025 F1 finale
content: Formula 1 has reached the 2025 season finale in Abu Dhabi, and one driver is yet to be crowned champion.

content: Who went No. 1 overall? Where did Maya Brady end up? All you need to know about the first AUSL player draft.

title: NFL odds: Bears underdogs at Packers, Ravens favored over Steelers
content: the Dallas Cowboys visit the Detroit Lions as underdogs on "Thursday Night Football" the cowboys have back-to-back wins over the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs . the Lions are coming off a loss at home to the Green Bay Packers .

content: coach: "you feel like you've got the same joy right now that we used to see? no" rumors that ball, Morant and Young could all be available in the trade deadline . a poll of executives, scouts and coaches conducted by ESPN .

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Liv Morgan takes over
content: the first "Raw" after Survivor Series began a season that will lead us to WrestleMania in April . the identity of the masked man who interfered at the end of the men's WarGames match wasn't close to being uncovered . neither was the next challenger to the women's tag team titles .

title: All-Star predictions: Which stars will we see in USA vs. the World?
content: the first selection process for the new USA vs. the world format this season will work almost the same as it has in the past . if the class of 24 All-Stars doesn't split perfectly into 16 american and eight international players . commissioner Adam Silver will add extra players to the roster to meet those minimums .

title: Bracketology: Michigan is the new No. 1 overall seed?!
content: headline no. 2: Michigan is really, really good, making the handful of us who picked the Wolverines to win it all feel positively splendid . they sit atop the season's first NET rankings, and most others of note .

content: 42 of the 48 qualifiers confirmed for 2026 world cup draw . a cavalcade of kits will be released in preparation for the event . the event will be staged in Canada, Mexico and the united states next summer .

title: Rankings for Week 14
content:
Field Yates breaks down Matthew Stafford's fantasy Week 13 performance and outlook against the Cardinals in Week 14. (0:57) ESPN's weekly PPR and IDP  fantasy football  rankings are an aggregate of our rankers (eight PPR, three IDP). They are Matt Bowen, Mike Clay, Tristan H. Cockcroft, Daniel Dopp, Eric Karabell, Liz Loza, Eric Moody and Field Yates. Karabell also provides his superflex rankings all season long. Rankings will be published every Tuesday and are updated throughout the week for news and emerging analysis. Week 14 byes:  Carolina Panthers ,  New England Patriots ,  New York Giants ,  San Francisco 49ers PPR rankings: 
 Quarterbacks  |  Running backs  |  Wide receivers  |  Tight ends  |  Kickers  |  D/ST IDP rankings: 
 Top 40 DLs, LBs, DBs from Clay, Cockcroft and Moody Eric Karabell's superflex rankings: 
 Top 150 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs

title: Newcomer slump? Why Bane, Turner and others were off to slow starts on new teams
content: despite averaging 13.9 points per game, the Orlando Magic shot 29% from 3-point range over the season's first eight games . "it's so new, I think everybody's searching," Bane told ESPN's Ohm Youngmisuk last month . he didn't see a presentation by former ESPN analyst Ben Alamar and ESPNâ€™s Dean Oliver .

title: Why Christian Pulisic might be in the midst of his best season as a pro
content: Christian Pulisic has sat out five games for AC Milan after tearing his hamstring in a friendly against Australia . the injury allowed him to maintain his place atop a hierarchy that only a handful of people with very specific occupations and/or very specific web-browsing habits are aware of .

title: College football national signing day live: Top commits, flips, moments
content: College football's national signing day kicked off Wednesday with the  early signing period .  Class of 2026  high school recruits who signed have locked into the college of their choice for at least the next year. The drama started early when Vanderbilt  flipped  five-star QB  Jared Curtis  from Georgia on Tuesday night. There are only eight ESPN 300 prospects who remain uncommitted, notably defensive end  Jordan Carter  (No. 57), the top uncommitted player, and QB  Peyton Falzone  (No. 225) who is the lone ranked, uncommitted quarterback. He decommitted from  Auburn  on Monday. If a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle begins Feb. 4. We are tracking the news, analysis and more throughout Wednesday. More:   Live class rankings updates  |  How the five-stars fit

title: Most accurate? Dak. Fastest rusher? Gibbs. We chose the NFL's top talent at 109 skills
content: we're picking out the NFL's top players by specific skills and traits ahead of the last month of the regular season . we pick out 109 traits and named the best player at each spot based on whining .

title: An All-Star for All-Star swap? MLB trade proposals that would rock the offseason
content: we asked our MLB insiders to give us their preferred destination for some of the biggest names in our ranking of the top 25 MLB offseason trade candidates . the new york Mets are acquiring Marcus Semien from the Texas Rangers for Brandon Nimmo and the Boston Red Sox adding Sonny Gray to their pitching staff .

title: Women's Power Rankings: Texas unseats UConn at No. 1 after big wins
content: the Players Era Championship in Las Vegas last week prompted a new no. 1 in ESPN's Power Rankings . the gamecocks and longhorns met four times in 2024-25: twice in the regular season, in the SEC tournament final and the national semifinals, with South Carolina winning three of the four . it's not the first time South Carolina coach Dawn Staley and Texas coach Vic Schaefer have been part of a rivalry .

title: Week 15 Anger Index: Biggest slights, snubs and shenanigans
content: the first college football playoff rankings came out five weeks ago . a few teams jockeying up or down a slot, but effectively no seismic shifts in the landscape . the ACC (Louisville to Cal, Virginia to Wake and Georgia Tech to Pitt) is the only two teams projected in the field in the first ranking .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who has a chance heading into the final weekend
content: if the ACC beats Virginia, it's not guaranteed a spot in the 12-team field . it could open the door for two conference champions to compete for a national title . at no. 12, the Hurricanes still need some help, but Alabama increased its chances .

title: ACC/SEC Women's Challenge guide: Can ACC make up ground after rough first month?
content: the ACC's list of disappointing results is much longer than a typical November for what is historically the best or second-best conference in the country . six SEC teams are still unbeaten . Texas and South Carolina just played each other in the Players Era championship game in Las Vegas .

title: Ranking men's basketball Freshman of the Year contenders: Cameron Boozer pulls away
content: darryn Peterson's return should up the drama of this freshman of the year race . he'll be eligible for a return in 50% or more of his team's games . but he is "very close" to his return, according to coach bill Self .

title: Man-animal conflict frays Indiaâ€™s wildlife conservation ethos
content: Centreâ€™s action plan seeks to address key drivers of conflict â€” habitat fragmentation, damaged corridors, and retaliatory killing â€” by promoting mitigation measures, data-driven monitoring, and stronger habitat protection

title: Missing public park: Madras High Court orders inquiry by Collector, Chennai Corporation
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say alleged encroachment of a public park by a private hospital is a serious issue

title: SC directs UPSC to deploy screen-reader software for visually impaired candidates, eases scribe change norms
content: Supreme Court mandated that every UPSC examination notification must include a clear provision permitting eligible candidates to request a change of scribe up to at least seven days before the examination

title: Gyanesh Kumar takes charge as head of International IDEA council
content: Indiaâ€™s chairmanship of the International IDEA council would be decisive, ambitious, and action-oriented, the Chief Election Commissioner said

title: Protest against coal mining turns violent in Chhattisgarhâ€™s Surguja, police personnel injured
content: â€˜Some villagers had received compensation for land acquisition, but many others refused to accept money and tried to obstruct mining operations,â€™ an official of the local administration said

title: Kerala to take part in foundational learning study
content: FLS will be conducted by PARAKH to gauge proficiency in reading and comprehension, writing, and numeracy

title: Loco pilotsâ€™ 48-hour hunger strike under way
content: Demands include, among others, an eight-hour limit to daily duty, a weekly off of 46 hours, only two consecutive night duty shifts instead of four in a week

title: Revanth invites Modi to Telangana Rising Global Summit
content: Submits memorandum to the Prime Minister requesting adequate funding for the development projects being undertaken as part of the Telangana Rising Vision and approval for all the pending projects; informs him that the State government has set a target of achieving a $3 trillion economy by 2047

title: TTD to christen Tirumala streets after religious personalities, philosophers
content: The endeavour is not merely administrative but devotional, an homage to those who offered their scholarship, artistry, wealth, and unwavering surrender at the feet of the Lord, says Additional Executive Officer Venkaiah Chowdary

title: BHU tense after clash between students and security staff
content: Police and PAC teams deployed as confrontation at Banaras Hindu University leads to damage and FIR under BNS provisions

title: Sankalpa Samarpana Samavesha in Sandur draws massive turnout
content: Minister Santosh S. Lad says development of marginalised communities is the governmentâ€™s core commitment

title: CISF bolsters presence as mass flight disruptions spark unrest at Hyderabad airport
content: A night-long delay on a Hyderabad-Bengaluru flight ended in a tense deplaning standoff, with passengers refusing to exit the aircraft until CISF personnel intervened

title: Tripura Congress collects over two lakh signatures against â€˜vote choriâ€™
content: The â€˜Vote chor, gaddi chhodâ€˜ campaign received enormous support from people across the State, Tripura Pradesh Congress Committee president Ashish Kumar Saha said

title: Bengaluruâ€™s outskirts expand rapidly but basic infrastructure collapses
content: Rapid growth and broken roads show how infrastructure is failing in and around the cityâ€™s tech corridor, Electronics City.

title: SIT submits progress report on Sabarimala gold theft before Kerala HC, granted six more weeks to complete  probe
content: Bearing in mind the scale, seriousness, and potential ramifications of the allegations under inquiry, the time sought by the investigating  officer is justified and deserves to be granted, observes the court

title: Telangana Rising Summit set to draw big names, bigger investments across sectors
content: $8 billion TCS-TPG hypervault data centre project, $100 million entertainment hub at Future City, Film City project by Ajay Devgn firm and many more investment announcements to be made

title: Manifestos of key fronts recognise need for regeneration of canals in Kochi
content: The issue had come into focus and become a major talking point after recent interventions by the National Green Tribunal and the Kerala High Court, following reports of poor water quality in two major canals â€” the Thevaraâ€“Perandoor (TP) and Edappally canals

title: YSRCP trying to stall Amaravati development, says TDP leader Devineni Umamaheswara Rao
content: The YSRCP continues to instil fear among the farmers about giving land under the second phase of Land Pooling Scheme to put the government in the dock for political gain, he says

title: Festive fervour returns to Tiruvannamalai on Maha Deepam day
content: The Karthigai Deepam festival of Sri Arunachaleswarar Temple that began on November 24 with the hoisting of a flag culminated with the lighting of the â€˜Maha Deepamâ€™ at 6 p.m. on December 3

title: Surveys sanctioned for four new railway lines in Andhra Pradesh, says Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Survey has also been sanctioned for construction of a 45-km line between Machilipatnam and Repalle to provide direct and shorter connectivity between the two towns, he tells Lok Sabha

title: SC directs Delhi riots accused to furnish permanent addresses
content: Bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and N.V. Anjaria sets time limits for remaining bail arguments in case linked to 2020 unrest

title: Higher duties on cigarettes will be shared with the States, Sitharaman clarifies in Lok Sabha
content: The Lok Sabha on December 3 passed the Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025, which would see higher excise duties being imposed on cigarettes.

title: Rajya Sabha takes up resolution to extend water pollution law to Manipur
content: Congress MP Neeraj Dangi said the resolution had to be presented in Parliament because the situation in Manipur has not improved

title: Vizhinjam port boasts many records on the first anniversary of commercial operation
content: In just 10 months, it became the fastest Indian port to handle 1 million TEUs cargo. 41 ultra-large container vessels that are 399+ metres long berthed at the port, highest for any Indian port.

title: Congress seat-sharing committee meets Stalin
content: it was a preliminary meeting, and â€œno numbers were spoken aboutâ€, says TNCC president K. Selvaperunthagai

title: Karnataka govt. finds itself in quota conundrum
content: The recent High Court order asking the government not to issue any fresh notifications on recruitment based on enhanced reservation has put it in a quandary

title: Thousands of recruitments will be on hold till further orders of the High Court: KEA
content: Even as North Karnataka witnessed protests in several places, Convener of Karnataka Job Seekersâ€™ Agitation Committee Yallappa Hegade hit out at the government for the current impasse.

title: NCBC recommends exclusion ofÂ 35 communities, mostly Muslim, from West Bengalâ€™s Central OBC list
content: The recommendation comes months after the NCBC initiated a probe into 37 communities included in the Central OBC list of West Bengal in 2014; the State will have Assembly polls in early 2026

title: MEIL receives safety excellence certificate from AP-Genco
content: The executing agency of the Polavaram Hydro Electric Project bags the certificate for completing 25 million man-hours without a single lost workday

title: Interlinking of rivers will help check drought in State, says A.P. CM Naidu
content: MSME parks will be set up in every Assembly constituency to encourage agri-based units, says Naidu, adding that power tariff for farm sector will not be hiked

title: Big boost to Aerospace & Defence sector in Andhra Pradesh
content: Four major defence production units by Bharat Dynamics Limited, HFCL Ltd., and Kalyani Strategic Systems Ltd., with an aggregate investment of â‚¹3,730 crore, are proposed to be established soon

title: Persons with disabilities are not inferior to anyone, says Horatti
content: Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council Basavaraj Horatti has said that physically challenged children had excelled in every field and they were in no way inferior to normal people.

title: Forest routes in SV National Park closed to pilgrims, public due to movement of wild elephants
content: Three herds of elephants, each with 15 to 17 animals, including six calves, have been frequently crossing the Balapalli, Railway Kodur and Rajampeta forest beats, warns Annamayya DFO
